title: Blended Learning-Based Instructional Design for Middle School Physical Education in K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Physical Education Theory and Practical Experience
context.additional_context: Application of a blended learning model in a middle school physical education curriculum within a smartphone-centric restricted technological environment. Requires activity design considering students' developmental stages and the establishment of an integrated online-offline assessment system.

learning_goals: Students complete assignments combining physical education theory (70%) and practical skills (30%) with over 80% completion rate in a 4-week blended learning environment
Learners enhance self-directed health management skills by documenting exercise logs twice weekly and receiving feedback via a smartphone app
Top 50% of 30 students measured by formative assessment on collaborative learning participation achieve team project outcomes

resources: Physical Education Equipment (Jump Ropes, Mats, etc.)
Basic Fitness Measurement Tools (Tape Measure, Stopwatch)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
